title: The impact of financial bond, social bond, and structural bond toward customer loyalty with customer satisfaction as intervening variable: a study of Bank Central asia's (BCA) customers in Surabaya
abstract: This research is conducted to understand the impact of financial bond, social bond, and structural bond towards customer loyalty with customer satisfaction as the mediation. This problem needs to be analyzed because of the increasing number middle class in Indonesia, switching behavior, and the decreasing market share of Bank Central Asia (BCA). The analysis in the research is done through Path analysis and Sobel test to describe the direct and indirect relationship between the independent and dependent variables. All the variables are also tested using classic assumption test, F-test, and t-test. The finding shows that the independent variables simultaneously impact the dependent variable and intervening variable. Besides that, the only independent variable that significantly have direct impact towards dependent variable and intervening variable is Social Bond. Lastly, there is significant partial indirect impact of independent variable towards dependent variable which mediated by intervening variable.
subjects: CUSTOMER LOYALTY; CUSTOMER RELATIONS-MARKETING; CONSUMER SATISFACTION.
